column4: ok. now when I restart cups it said that child exits with code 98
yes, I am accessing it with localhost:631
But when I log in it tells me that web administration is disabled
I can try that, even though I'm root already :)
should it be /etc/init.d/cupsd? In debian it's cupsys (and ubuntu)
I booted from knoppix and chrooted to change my root passwd
only after that I read the FAQ and found out about the sudo thing
ok. I'll email it to someone else and they can print it :)
oh you have a root password! what is it? :)
it doesn't take much to make gnome-terminal crash
but it's annoying. i love gnome-terminal every other way
i think it's a gnome 2.10 feature :)
i can't debug now because my work box is down, but could this be because of the sunOS/linux switches?
anything is possible, my improbability drive isn't working now, but as soon as my new kernel has compiled I'll tell you.

my vacation starts today so i shut it down. what was i thinking! :)
